p: Ten-fold serial dilution of the RNA from four DENV stocks were used as the standards to determine the sensitivity of the novel DENV RT-LAMP assay. The initial titers of the DENV-1, DENV-2, DENV-3, and DENV-4 stocks were 4 × 10 6, 1 × 10 7, 2 × 10 4, and 1.6 × 10 7 plaque-forming unit (PFU) per ml. To determine the RNA copy numbers of the virus stocks, RT-qPCR assay was performed with previously described primers ( Supplementary Table S1; Go et al., 2016), and a standard curve was obtained by 10-fold serial dilutions of in vitro transcribed DENV RNA standard from 10 7 to 10 2 copies/μl. The RNA copy numbers of DENV-1, DENV-2, DENV-3, and DENV-4 stocks were quantified to be 1.6 × 10 8, 1.1 × 10 8, 9.3 × 10 6, and 1.2 × 10 7 copies/ml, respectively.
